cbccore.movement
Class DriveTrain

java.lang.Object
  cbccore.movement.DriveTrain
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreateDriveTrain, MotorDriveTrain
public abstract class DriveTrain
extends java.lang.Object

Allows you to move the MotorDriveTrain or Create through high-level, consistant abstracted commands. Centimeters and radians are used as the default units, although for convenience, degree versions of the methods are provided. Counter-clockwise is the default direction of rotation. This class implements most of the hard things, so subclassing this abstract should be very easy. You really only need to fill in a few things like directDrive.

Author:
Benjamin Woodruff
See Also:
MotorDriveTrain, CreateDriveTrain

moveCurveDegrees

public void moveCurveDegrees(double degrees,
                             double radius,
                             double cmps)
Moves the robot in a piece of a circle.

Parameters:
degrees - The piece of the circle defined as a change in the robot's rotation in degrees
radius - The radius of the circle.
cmps - The Centimeters-Per-Second of the center of the robot. The maximum value for this is less than maxCmps
See Also:
moveCurveRadians(double, double, double)

moveCm

public void moveCm(double cm,
                   double cmps)
            throws InvalidValueException
Moves robot forward a certain number of centimeters at a set speed. If you specify a negitive number for cm, the robot will move backwards that many centimeters.

Parameters:
cm - Desired distance in centimeters
cmps - Desired speed in centimeters-per-second
Throws:
InvalidValueException

stop

public void stop()
Just mirrors (calls) freeze()

See Also:
stop(), kill()

freeze

public abstract void freeze()
Should lock both the robot's motors if possible, otherwise it should call kill()

See Also:
stop(), kill()

kill

public void kill()
Stops the robot by setting the speed to zero. If a different mechanism is needed for stopping, you can override this method.

See Also:
stop(), freeze()

Gets the maximum speed in centimeters-per-second for the robot.

The maximum speed in centimeters-per-second for the robot.
